newsitem.title: USA: NHL ICE HOCKEY-DONATO'S SECOND GOAL TAKES BRUINS PAST WHALERS IN OVERTIME.
newsitem.headline: NHL ICE HOCKEY-DONATO'S SECOND GOAL TAKES BRUINS PAST WHALERS IN OVERTIME.

text.p: Ted Donato's second goal of the game 2:21 into overtime lifted the Boston Bruins to a 5-4 victory over the Hartford Whalers on Thursday.
Adam Oates slid a pass from the top of the right faceoff circle down low to the right side of the net, where Donato flipped a shot over goaltender Jason Muzzatti for his 12th goal of the season.
"I wish it was that easy, but we stayed with it, we needed a good start tonight and we got it," Donato said.
Don Sweeney and Oates each set up two goals for Boston, which snapped a four-game winless streak.
At New Jersey, Fredrik Olausson and Jaromir Jagr scored 42 seconds apart in the second period and Patrick Laline made 31 saves and the Pittsburgh Penguins routed the New Jersey Devils 6-1.
Mario Lemieux had four assists and Jason Wooley three for Pittsburgh, which improved to 6-0-1 in its last seven games.
First-period goals by Ron Francis and Stu Barnes staked the Penguins to a 2-0 lead.
In New York, Alexander Karpovtsev scored the tying goal with 6:48 remaining and Mark Messier's second goal of the game 3:18 later gave the New York Rangers a 4-3 victory over the New York Islanders.
The Islanders carried a 3-2 lead into the third period but Karpovtsev's fourth goal tied it.
Messier capped a pretty give-and-go with Brian Leetch, snapping a one-timer past Salo's left side from the right circle for a 4-3 lead on Messier's 22nd goal of the season.
In Chicago, Bob Corkum's third goal of the season midway through the third period broke a tie and Nikolai Khabibulan made 27 saves as the Phoenix Coyotes beat the Chicago Blackhawks 4-2.
Keith Tkachuk added an empty net tally with 1:09 remaining to ice the win, his 13th goal in his last 11 games. Tony Amonte scired both Chicago goals.
In St Louis, Brett Hull scored with 85 seconds left in the third period to lift the St. Louis Blues into a 2-2 tie with the Montreal Canadiens.
Chris Pronger also scored for the Blues. Vincent Damphousse scored both goals for the Canadiens.
At Colorado, Uwe Krupp scored with 2:15 remaining to snap a tie and lift the Colorado Avalanche to their fifth straight victory, 3-2 over the struggling Calgary Flames.

With the game tied 2-2, Joe Sakic won a faceoff in the right circle and drew the puck back off the boards to Krupp, who blasted a high slap shot over Trevor Kidd's left shoulder for his fourth goal of the season.
It was Sakic's also his 800th career point.
In Vancouver, Pavel Bure had two goals and an assist and Alexander Mogilny added a goal and two asssists as the Vancouver Canucks beat the reeling Los Angeles Kings 4-3.
Donald Brashear also scored and Adrian Aucoin had two assists for Vancouver, which snapped a four-game losing streak.
Jeff Shevalier, Kai Nurminen and Ed Olczyk scored for the Kings.

In San Jose, Ron Hextall made 26 saves and Daniel Lacroix and Eric Lindros scored second-period goals, helping the Philadelphia Flyers extend their unbeaten streak to 15 games with a 4-1 victory over the San Jose Sharks.
Dainius Zubrus and Rod Brind'Amour also scored for the Flyers, who improved to 13-0-2 in their last 15 games.
